content:
I haven't had the opportunity to see restaurants that grow their own food in person. but i can tell you that there are many restaurants that do this in different parts of the world.

for example, the french laundry restaurant in yountville, california has an on-site garden where they grow their own herbs, fruits and vegetables for their dishes. noma, a two michelin-starred restaurant in copenhagen, denmark has an extensive farming operation with its own greenhouse where they grow everything from fruit trees to edible flowers to be used in their dishes. another example is olmsted in brooklyn, new york that has a backyard garden where they grow a variety of vegetables. similarly, the london-based restaurant petersham nurseries has an on-site farm where they grow their own organic produce.

these are just a few examples of restaurants that grow their own food on-site. it's a sustainable practice that not only reduces the restaurant's carbon footprint, but also provides guests with fresh, seasonal and locally sourced ingredients.
